item.title: Dcode Capital, Albedo, and Biofire are coming to TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
In a world where innovation knows no borders, a new trend is rising in the tech ecosystem: national-interest startups. From aerospace and defense to critical infrastructure, these firms are ensuring that innovation directly supports national growth, security, and prosperity. As we approach an inflection point in Silicon Valley’s evolution, the question arises: Can startups rebuild […]

item.title: Upchieve, an online tutor app for low-income students, launches a free tool for teachers
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Upchieve, the free, 24/7 online tutoring and college counseling app for low-income students, announced Thursday it’s giving teachers in Title 1 middle schools and high schools a new tool to ensure their students get the academic support they need. The new offering, called “Upchieve for Teachers,” allows teachers to offer 1:1 support to their students. […]

item.title: Announcing our next wave of Startup Battlefield judges at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Richard Smith
item.description:
Startup Battlefield 200 is a major highlight at every Disrupt, and we’re thrilled to find out which of the thousands of startup applicants will get the chance to pitch to top-tier VCs at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024. Join us at Moscone West in San Francisco from October 28–30 to witness the epic showdown where every contender […]

item.title: Amazon releases a video generator — but only for ads
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Like its rival, Google, Amazon has launched an AI-powered video generator — but it’s only for advertisers at the moment, and somewhat limited in what it can do. Today at its Accelerate conference, Amazon unveiled Video generator, which turns a single product image into video showcases of that product after some amount of processing. The […]

item.title: Tidal Metals sees seawater as the solution to a critical mineral shortage
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The startup, previously known as GreenBlu, was working on desalination when it realized there was more value in the minerals that were left behind.

item.title: Amazon debuts an AI assistant for sellers, Project Amelia
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Amazon sellers now have access to an AI assistant designed to help them grow their business by answering questions about their metrics, and later, may be able to help them directly resolve issues that arise. The assistant, code-named Project Amelia and built on AWS’s Amazon Bedrock, will initially be available in beta to U.S. sellers, […]

item.title: Kiwibot acquires an ad startup to turn its delivery robots into mobile billboards
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
There’s ample opportunity in the form of a mobile billboard. Kiwibot is so convinced of this fact that it plunked down $25 million to purchase Nickelytics.

item.title: Harbor is building a better baby monitor and an army of night nannies
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Like most good startup stories, Harbor began life as a product of disappointment. Kevin Lavelle, the co-founder and CEO of innovative clothing company Mizzen and Main, couldn’t find a baby monitor to suit his needs. He and his wife, Jen, had homed in on Nanit, a popular product renowned for its AI smarts and and […]

item.title: AI notetaker Fathom raises $17M
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
In many meetings today, it sometimes feels like there are more AI notetaking and transcription bots than people. There are seemingly dozens of options to choose from these days, but one I’ve seen with increasing regularity is Fathom. The company was one of the earlier players when it launched in 2020. Fathom then raised a […]

item.title: Karman Industries hopes its SpaceX-inspired heat pumps will replace industrial boilers
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The startup will use turbomachinery to develop a heat pump capable of generating industrial-grade heat.

item.title: EU to tell Apple how to do interoperability, DMA style
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
The European Union has opened two “specification proceedings” on Apple under the bloc’s Digital Markets Act (DMA) that will see it instructing the iPhone maker on how to comply with certain interoperability provisions in the market fairness regulation. If Apple fails to meet the Commission’s requirements it could risk fines of up to 10% of […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: This founder grew up in wine country — now he’s built a platform for wine makers
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Growing up in the Hunter Valley, a region of Australia renowned for its fine wine production, Mitchel Fowler never realized he might one day think of an idea that could revolutionize the wine industry. Now, after a long career in finance, he has returned to that heritage to launch a platform to solve the wine […]

item.title: Picus Security, founded by 3 Turkish mathematicians, raises $45M after simulating 1B cyber attacks
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Picus Security, which runs continuous validation processes to root out and fix inconsistencies in code, has raised $45 million in a Series C round.

item.title: Brightband sees a bright (and open-source) future for AI-powered weather forecasting
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
With an explosion of weather and climate data that the last generation of tools can’t handle, is AI the future of forecasting? Research certainly suggests so, and a newly funded startup called Brightband is taking a shot at turning machine learning forecast models into both a business and open source standard. Today’s weather prediction and […]

item.title: AI governance can’t be left to the vested interests
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
A final report by the UN’s high level advisory body on artificial intelligence makes for, at times, a surreal read. Named ‘Governing AI for Humanity’, the document underlines the contradictory challenges of making any kind of governance stick on such a fast developing, massively invested and heavily hyped technology. On the one hand, the report […]

item.title: India weighs easing market share limits for UPI payment operators

item.description:
The governing body overseeing India's popular UPI payments rail is considering increasing its proposed market share cap for operators like Google Pay, PhonePe and Paytm.

item.title: Palmer Luckey returns to headsets as Anduril partners with Microsoft on U.S. military tech
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
Palmer Luckey, the Hawaiian-shirt wearing founder who sold Oculus VR for $2 billion before co-founding the military tech company Anduril, is back in the headset business — in a sense. Anduril will soon embed its software into the Integrated Visual Augmentation System headset developed by Microsoft for the U.S. military in 2021.  According to Wired, […]

item.title: CEO of self-driving startup Motional is stepping down
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Motional, the autonomous vehicle startup backed by Hyundai, is shaking up its leadership ranks. Karl Iagnemma, an early pioneer in the autonomous vehicle industry whose startup Nutonomy lies at the foundation of Motional, is stepping down as president and CEO. Iagnemma will move over to a senior strategy advisor role, while CTO Laura Major will […]
